title: What if we gave Akali the Azir treatment?
body:
What I mean is make it to where her shroud's duration is reduced whenever she is under tower.

Or, possibly, make it to where it takes more time for her to go into stealth when she is under tower, that way she can get hit by tower shots.

I'm not saying this because I hate Akali, and want to see her die in a hole. Instead, I want to play her. I devoted an entire month to playing her, and even have 2 mastery 7 tokens for her sitting in my loot table.

I don't care if people ban her more than Yasuo, I can work with that. I just want to be able to play a champ I like without feeling like I'm having the champ work against me.

Unfortunately, Riot is against removing her true invisibility, so, I'm just trying to find a middle ground, that way she can get some power back into her kit, and actually feel like a real champ!

And to make things worse, this isn't a situation where Akali is strong in pro-play, and must be toned down so she doesn't dominate the pro-scene. Sure, she's *good* in pro play, but nothing like Azir, Ryze, or Kalista where they thrive on twitch gameplay, and team coordination.

replies.body:
I'm not necessarily against the suggestion, but we *should* just remove the Obscured mechanic since that is the root of the problem.

Emphasis on "should", since Riot seems to be vehemently against this.

According to I-forget-who (I think mort?) about half the balance team wants to just remove it.

They removed Pink Ward countering when Pink Wards were replaced with Control Wards.
I swear you could have bought control wards to counter the shroud. Could be wrong. Its been a long time since I remembered how her shroud worked pre rework (rarely played her or saw her)
Nah it didnt work, the only champ which can still be reveal by pink is {{champion:28}} since the ward rework.
{{champion:107}} {{champion:29}} too
Wait not Vayne or Kha'zix?
2 different types of stealth. Rengar, Pyke, Twitch and Evelyynn still can be revealed, the rest can't.
Which makes Vayne's buff even more perplexing.

Which is why TF is a secret god tier counterpick. Completely invalidates her ult.

And ofc Lee Sin’s “i have stealth reveal on every ability cuz why not” is good too.
No true sight on Lee's E anymore, thank goodness.
really that seems more balanced for e than q Sure q is a skill shot but e has so little going for it and has such a small aoe.

Still, that's how stealth is *supposed* to work. People have to invest in control wards/sweepers to be able to know where you are, that's how it should be. You can't just go making a stealth that literally renders you untargetable for almost 10s while that same person rips you a new anal sphincter and give zero counterplay to it. That's not how stealth works.
no, its not hard to play around at all. i dont understand why people refuse to learn how to play against it.

> [{quoted}](name=Akali Prime,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=V3crxO6d,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2019-01-23T17:50:56.470+0000)
>
> no, its not hard to play around at all. i dont understand why people refuse to learn how to play against it.

It's clearly too hard to play against for the majority of people considering Akali's ban rate.

There's 3 ways to play against it: Ban her, pick someone whose entire kit is massive AoE, or sit in well to not feed her even though she's sitting under your turret in stealth at level 4 ripping you to shreds and taking no tower hits.

You're right. Much counterplay. Such wow.

No shes not murdering you under tower at level 4.

Her stealth reset isnt short enough that you cant at least hit her, the tower certainly will, and even dumping her full combo on you - ignoring that the tower would kill her first - she'd only be able to kill you if you stood there and took it.

Fact is they could remove the stealth under tower and it wouldnt change much.

People simply arent interested in changing their playstyle. You cant deal with an Akali the same way you can deal with any old champion.

Her shroud has very obvious and exploitable flaws, but they arent things people consider when fighting her, because they expect to be able to dump their whole kit on her, she dies, and they get patted on the back for being good at game.
That's only a valid move to make if Akali is already winning the lane.  If you tower dive when behind, even with her W, you're going to die.
What if they've tried to do just that internally and realized that akali can't do her job at all without it short of making her a stat-check champion.

Lets be honest, isn't the point of an assassin to stat-check a squishy with their burst anyway? If you don't have the stats to survive the burst, even the shittiest assassin in the game will still delete you.

But you're right. If they remove the Obscurity from her W, she will need a complete power distribution shift across her kit so she'll need multiple buffs in other areas in exchange for losing the most powerful stealth available.

Obscurity could maybe be fine on another champ but this Akali has too much mobility and too much early game power if used correctly to make it fair.
Her true stealth under tower (or at all) is not a problem. When is boards going to drop this non-issue?

Upvoted, it is shame that boards are kinda ignorant, plus I think they never actually even played vs good akali. What do you think about her passive tho, in right hands it still feels strong(I'm only in low dia tho). 

Anyway love when papa Moody spills some truth around, just to harvest these juicy downvotes.

I think Akali's passive is fine. If I had to complain about anything it would probably be how I don't really have any way to deal with her Q short of just not being in its range. She has a lot more non-committal damage than before.
She re enters stealth too quickly period, not just under tower.
Hard fighting someone that by time you click on them they restealth and it cancels.

It doesn't cancel:

"Targeted abilities and uncancellable basic attacks (e.g.  Nasus'  Siphoning Strike) are no longer canceled when Akali stealths or re-stealths"

> [{quoted}](name=Raven Redeemed,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=V3crxO6d,comment-id=000c00000001,timestamp=2019-01-23T21:48:59.449+0000)
>
> It doesn't cancel:
> 
> "Targeted abilities and uncancellable basic attacks (e.g.  Nasus'  Siphoning Strike) are no longer canceled when Akali stealths or re-stealths"

Let me Just quote this for you. 

>uncancellable basic attacks

Those other basic attacks though... Yea the thing is not all basic attacks are "Uncancellable"

I have to give the heathen this one: the only autoattack that can currently be cancelled by simply breaking sight is Kalista's, currently.

The rest will hit you...as long as you can start them in the tiny, TINY window between her stealth and re-stealth.
(which means you really still cant unless youre running it on a supercomputer...but still)

I wish Riot would just admit they are wrong and revert her shroud to her previous one and get rid of true stealth. The champion is so bad in Solo Q because she literally cant carry games and true stealth takes up too much of her power budget. All theyd have to do to make her good again and not as frustrating are these few things.

- Just remove true stealth and revert her shroud to pre-rework
- Lower the size or remove the passive circle from hitting enemies with abilties
- Reduce the delay between R1 and R2 from 2.5 to 1.5 or 1 second

Boom. Shes less frustrating to deal with as true stealth is gone and it allows her some power back without actually buffing her numbers. This pushes her back towards an assassin and less like a skirmisher which will make doing her job of assassinating and carrying games much easier in solo Q.

For those saying that pro players are reflexively banning her, or that she is not a problem, etc. just check out Chovy from Griffin doing a 1v4 and getting a double kill after taking out their turret.
Happened just a few hours again. Game 2, Spring Split GRF vs HLE.
She is, in no way, balanced.

You cant use that clip as Akali being overpowered. Hes up 5 levels on the enemy jungler, 7 levels on the support, 2 levels on his mid lane opponent and 4 levels on the Viktor. He was so far ahead any other assassin would have killed them all with the lead he had. Really bad example there.
No, still a shining example. **How** was he so overleveled? It wasn't magic, it was a busted-ass champion.

You clearly didnt watch the game. Their entire team outmatched them which allowed her to get up in levels during splitting. Malz counters Akali very hard they just played that game poorly. I get that people hate the champion but at least use valid examples instead of one match in pro play where she got very far ahead. Last i checked shes done poorly so far this split in most games.

Let me just stop you at "Malz hard counters Akali, but lost"

Cause that's really all you need to look at. I hate the rework, not that champion. I liked the old Akali, and this new one feels really dumbed-down by comparison to me. But I really don't see how that has anything to do with why her shroud is busted. And it IS the shroud: if the remove it, the rest of her now dumbed-down kit would have to be turned into a bunch of stat checks in order to even feel relevant.

Wait, the rework feels dumbed down to you? It's anything but to me. Passive requires interaction, Q is a skill shot (easy to land, but not as easy a targeted Q) which only slows at the edge, W doesn't have a center (go left or right?) and requires constant de/restealthing to optimize, E has so many factors to consider (easy short dash vs long skill shot dash, use right away or save to follow a mobility spell), and her ult is now a skill shot with a time lockout on the second charge.

Old Akali was only targeted spells or stats, pretty much the definition of a stat check.

Old passive required interaction, Q required you to proc the mark with an auto for any significant damage, her only form of mobility was from her ult, which required a target, and her W actually had counterplay other than running way the fuck away from it so she cant get free damage for the next 10s unless you had multiple AoEs.

She wasn't a stat check, she was a cranium check. Now she's braindead, and without her W giving her 10s immunity to targeted abilities and autoattacks, she'd be a nobody.

They ruined her.

Are you saying she is dumbed down or too strong? Her new passive and Q are obviously less braindead she has to AA (like before) but also move in and out, aim a skill shot, and manage energy. Her new W is essentially the same (in how she uses it) except now she has to plan her routs and commit to a general direction in addition to unsteathing and restealthing. Her new E is wayyy less braindead like I mentioned before. And her ult is a skill shot with a time lock out which requires planning ahead. The _only_ shred of complexity she lost was managing her ult stacks and its resets and using the small blink on her W.

She's not too strong. Her W is too strong. And without her W, she's trash.

If that doesn't make what I'm saying clear enough, idk how to break it down further than that, cause I don't speak vegetable.

Ah, I see.

You may not speak vegetable, but for future reference, "dumbed down" is not synonymous with "too strong" or "too weak" in the common English vernacular.

Then I advise you not compare feeling dumbed down with whether or not something is too strong or weak.

Good day sir.
I will compare them if someone erroneously implies they are the same thing so they can avoid the mistake in the future.
